SortedVectors.jl

  • Readme
  • Docstrings
    • Docstrings
    Docstrings
    SortedVectors.AssumeSorted — Type.

    Flag for indicating that

    1. the argument should be assumed to be sorted, and this should not be checked,
    2. the argument vector will not be modified later.

    Not exported.

    SortedVectors.CheckSorted — Type.

    Flag for indicating that

    1. sorting should be verified,
    2. the argument vector will not be modified later.

    Not exported.

    SortedVectors.SortedVector — Type.
    SortedVector([lt=isless], xs)

    Sort xs by lt (which defaults to isless) and wrap in a SortedVector. For reverse sorting, use !lt.

    SortedVector(SortedVectors.CheckSorted(), lt, sorted_contents)

    Checks that the vector is sorted, throws an ArgumentError if it isn't. This is a relatively cheap operation if the vector is supposed to be sorted but this should be checked. Caller should copy the sorted_contents if they are mutable and may be modified.

    SortedVector(SortedVectors.AssumeSorted(), lt, sorted_contents)

    Unchecked, unsafe constructor. Use only if you are certain that sorted_contents is sorted according to lt, otherwise results are undefined. copy the sorted_contents if they are mutable and may be modified.

    SortedVectors.SortedVectors
    SortedVectors.cut — Function.
    cut(x, breaks; left, right)

    Return i such that breaks[i] < x ≤ breaks[i + 1], where < is the sorting from the second argument.

    When x ≤ breaks[1], left (0 by default) is used, and right (default: length) for x > breaks[end].
